hurricane_florence_september_2018.title: Hurricane Florence (September 2018)
hurricane_florence_september_2018.description: Hurricane Florence wrecked havoc on the Carolinas. Use the A|B tool to see a before and after of the coast.

california_british_columbia_wildfires_su.title: California & British Columbia Wildfires (Summer 2018)
california_british_columbia_wildfires_su.description: Use different layers to look at the wildfires on the west North American coasts. See how smoke from the wildfire travels eastward.

snow_in_lesotho_south_africa_august_2018.title: Snow in Lesotho, South Africa (August 2018)
snow_in_lesotho_south_africa_august_2018.description: Snow in South Africa is a rare event. Use the zoom tool and percipitation layers to look at this event.

saharan_dust_storms_2018.title: Saharan Dust Storms (2018)
saharan_dust_storms_2018.description: Did you know dust from the African Sahara can travel across the ocean to North America? See for yourself!

sinabung_volcano_eruption_february_2018.title: Sinabung Volcano Eruption (February 2018)
sinabung_volcano_eruption_february_2018.description: Use carbon dioxide and sulfur layers to look at the Sinabung Volcano.

hurricane_maria_september_2017.title: Hurricane Maria (September 2017)
hurricane_maria_september_2017.description: Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico. Follow the storm as it forms from a tropical depression to a category 4 hurricane.

larsen_c_ice_shelf_iceberg_a68a_july_201.title: Larsen C Ice Shelf / Iceberg A68A - July 2017
larsen_c_ice_shelf_iceberg_a68a_july_201.description: Explore the Larsen C Ice Shelf using different map projections, zoom levels and layers. Use the event tab to quickly acess other events.

explore_the_earth_at_night_2012_2016.title: Explore The Earth at Night (2012 - 2016)
explore_the_earth_at_night_2012_2016.description: Use various layers to explore regions of the earth at night!

shrinking_aral_sea_2001_2018.title: Shrinking Aral Sea (2001 - 2018)
shrinking_aral_sea_2001_2018.description: See how decades of water diversion, coupled with regional droughts, have caused the Aral Sea basic to dry out.
